alert.note: Alert for Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 3:47AM PST until December 07 at 7:13AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. .The upper reaches of the Skagit have crested. The flood crest will move downstream reaching Mount Vernon late this morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skagit River near Mt. Vernon. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, the Skagit River will flood from Sedro Woolley downstream through Mount Vernon to the mouth. Flood waters will inundate some low-lying roads...farmlands and residential areas. This level for this location on the Skagit corresponds to a phase 3 flood in the Skagit County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 28.8 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to crest at 30.1 feet late this morning. The river will slowly recede this afternoon then fall below flood stage tonight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at noon PST.
